revised_title: Evolution of Nuptial Gift Size in Bushcrickets
tldr: This study investigates the relationship between nuptial gift size, sperm number, and ejaculate volume in bushcrickets. The research finds a positive correlation between contrasts in spermatophylax mass and contrasts in both ampulla mass and sperm number, supporting the ejaculate protection hypothesis. The findings suggest that the large spermatophylax in bushcrickets has evolved to ensure complete sperm transfer during mating.
